name: Introduction to Media Studies
description: This course introduces the field of media studies. It covers topics such as media history, media theories, media technologies, and media analysis. It also introduces the student to the various research methods in media studies.

name: Research Methods in Media Studies
description: This course introduces students to the various research methods used in media studies. It covers topics such as qualitative and quantitative research, content analysis, surveys, and interviews.

name: Media Theory and Analysis
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of the various theories and analytical approaches used to study media. It covers topics such as semiotics, psychoanalysis, discourse analysis, and critical theory.

name: Media History
description: This course covers the history of media from its earliest stages to the present. It examines the development of media technologies, the impact of media on society, and the evolution of media regulation.
